page.title: 08Food in 1945 (contd)
page.content: NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 _________________ Q.What meat did they eat? We ate a lot of tinned meat Corned Beef was very popular and then they brought out spatan which was a sort of Luncheon meat which was very nice.They also brought out a fish called Snoek and I can remember for breakfast on Sunday we always had Saltfish which was salted cod soaked in water overnight.I can also remember having Pineapple chunks and when you had finished with the tin you would put it on top of the ash bin so the neighbours thought you were posh.Sweet rationing was a D 2ozs or an E quarter of a pound.A large loaf was 2 new pence in 1945
